alert.note: Alert for St. Clair (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 03 at 3:07PM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: .Moderate north wind over southern Lake Huron is elevating water level into the St Clair river with flow further restricted by ice. The wind speed and direction is expected to continue tonight through Friday morning leading additional water level rise and ice blockage flooding during this time. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE BLOCKAGE IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST FRIDAY... ...REPLACES FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by ice blockage is expected. * WHERE...Along the St. Clair River from St. Clair down to Algonac in St. Clair county. * WHEN...Until noon EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 253 PM EST, Emergency management and river gages indicated flooding is expected due to north wind, ice restricted river flow, and ice blockages of the river. Flooding is likely for the rest of today through Friday morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... St. Clair, East China Township, Algonac, Marine City and Pearl Beach. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Take steps to protect property near the river and stay a safe distance from the river banks.
